div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px red;

ul.li:
The combination of
Counter Helix and
Berserker's Call can disable multiple Meepos and deal heavy area damage.
Axe's natural high survivability makes it difficult to burst him down with Poof or chip away at his health with Geostrike.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px red;

ul.li:
Breathe Fire and
Elder Dragon Form 's splash damage can hit multiple Meepo clones.

Breathe Fire 's damage reduction and the increased survivability from
Dragon Blood allow Dragon Knight to outlast Meepo in direct combat.
Dragon Tail can be used to stun a weakened Meepo and finish it off.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px red;

ul.li: Echo Slam deals catastrophic damage against a cluster of Meepos and anyone nearby.
He can potentially stunlock any number of Meepos for a fairly long duration, often enough to finish one off.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px red;

ul.li:
Sleight of Fist boosted by
Battle Fury and
Daedalus makes quick work of Meepo via massive cleave damage.
Searing Chain interrupting Meepo's initiating because Meepo's Clone can't have spell immunity.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px red;

ul.li: Tidebringer 's cleave damage can wear down Meepo's clones quickly. It can also give Meepo problems in lane, due to his melee range and initially low health pool.

Ghostship and
Torrent can effectively disable Meepo while dealing heavy damage. If
Aghanim's Scepter is purchased, Ghostship can also drag the Meepo clones out of position and set up a teammate's follow-up abilities.
X Marks the Spot prevents attempts to escape using Poof.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px red;

ul.li:
Great Cleave and
God's Strength can take down Meepo and his clones very quickly.

The lack of Spell Immunity for Meepo's clones makes him very vulnerable to
Storm Hammer .

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px red;

ul.li: Reflection illusions attack all Meepos.
Sunder can give Terrorblade a chance to kill Meepo after being close to death.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px red;

ul.li: Winter's Curse is a hard counter to Meepo. Casting it on Meepo or any of his clones will literally cause Meepo to kill himself.

Heroes with powerful area-of-effect disables can initiate on Meepo and his clones and shut him down, such as
Enigma ,
Magnus ,
Puck ,
Sand King ,
Silencer ,
Tidehunter , and
Winter Wyvern .

Because only one clone needs to be killed in order to kill Meepo, heroes that excel at singling out enemies can also be a detriment to him, such as
Batrider ,
Beastmaster ,
Clockwerk , and
Pudge .

Lich 's
Chain Frost can bounce between Meepos and deal heavy damage if his clones are grouped together and no one else is nearby. However, with higher levels of Divided We Stand and his high innate magic resistance, Chain Frost will deal minimal damage to each Meepo unless Lich has
Aghanim's Scepter . This ultimate is also not very reliable, as more advanced Meepo players will be able to split their clones to end the ultimate.
Jakiro 's Ice Path and Macropyre can easily trap one or more Meepos, giving the enemy a chance to nuke him down or focus a single weak clone.
Timbersaw Chakram will slow Meepo when he Earthbinds. If he cannot kill Timber quick enough, his huge pure nuke can make quick work of Meepo, who is naturally weak to AoE pure damage nukes.
Bristleback 's Quill Spray and Bristleback (Passive) is useful when both initiating or being initiated on as Meepo has high attack speedâ€” which will proc Bristleback more.

Batrider 's Flaming lasso can become annoying when Batrider has a team nearby to kill the disabled Meepo. His firefly is also good AoE damage, which when stacked with sticky napalm (which is AoE too and can hit all Meepos) he becomes a very formidable target.
Tiny 's Avalanche affects all Meepo and toss can send a singular Meepo into death. If Tiny builds Black King Bar, he can also survive Meepo's Poof combo, due to his decent amount of tank.

Techies Is an overall decent hero against Meepo, his Blast Off dispensing high amounts of AoE damage and a crippling AoE silence. His Stasis traps are also very good in a teamfight against Meepo, as he will never buy spell immunity, thus will be unable to avoid the disable. Techies' Remote mines and Trip Mines are also a direct counter to Meepo's highly split-pushing and split-farming oriented gameplay, as if the Meepo player is not very good at micromanagement and always paying complete attention, they may miss the activation sounds of the mines and take a large amount of damage. Or simply try to push a tower and walk into a large minefield.

Riki 's Smoke Screen interrupts Meepo's casting and Trick of the Trade is wide enough to attack all Meepos without targeting the weakest one. If Riki builds any Bash or Cleave items, Meepo may die before Riki's channeling ends.
Nyx Assassin 's Impale can stun many Meepos as the clones cannot get spell immunity. Another way Nyx can stun Meepo is by using Spike Carapace and Vendetta while Meepo is using Poof.
Shadow Fiend 's Requiem of Souls not only slow all Meepos, it can kill the weakest Meepo instantly if the ult is released at the right position and time.
Ursa's Enrage give him a chance after Poofed for killing Meepo
Invoker.

Disruptor is an counter to Meepo in many ways. His
Thunder Strike can deal good AoE damage and can be very annoying when multiple Meepos are low health.
Glimpse , when timed right, can return a poofing Meepo back into your team.
Kinetic Field can be very good to limit Meepo's mobility in a team fight, and can stop him from chasing down your entire team. Finally,
Static Storm is a very good silence that does large amounts of AoE damage, either punishing a Meepo who is fighting into your team, or stopping him from escaping with poof.
Battle Fury 's cleave helps wear down Meepo's clones.
Black King Bar can protect a hero from Poof and Earthbind. Keep in mind, however, that Geostrike's slow pierces Spell Immunity.

Maelstrom and
Mjollnir 's Chain Lightning can hit multiple Meepo clones, and Static Charge can inflict many damage instances if cast on a hero being attacked by Meepo.

Single-target disables, such as
Scythe of Vyse ,
Orchid Malevolence , and
Abyssal Blade , along with the bashes from
Skull Basher and
Monkey King Bar can prevent a lone Meepo from escaping with Poof.
Items with dispel like Black King Bar, Manta Style, Lotus Orb and Guardian Greaves can be bought purge Earthbound allies or yourself.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px chartreuse;

ul.li:
Earthbind can prevent Anti-Mage's
Blink , allowing Meepo to quickly kill him with Poof.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px chartreuse;

ul.li:
Reality Rift is useless, because the other Meepos can Earthbind and Poof all of Chaos Knight's
Phantasm Illusions.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px chartreuse;

ul.li:
When Legion Commander used
Duel on one Meepo, he can use his other Meepos to kill her (But if Main Meepo dueled, he may lose) If he wasn't dueled, he can help the teammate who was duelled to give him victory point instead Legion Commander.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px chartreuse;

ul.li: Poof will destroy Phantom Lancer's illusions within short time.
Doppelganger may escapes Earthbind, but if he and his illusions are Earthbinded again, Meepo will deliver Poof to find the real one and kill him.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px chartreuse;

ul.li:
Chain of Earthbinds prevents her from
Blink , allowing Meepo to quickly kill her with Poof and autoattacks.
Meepo has higher magic resistance than average and tends to build stats-based items mitigating Queen of Pain's magic burst.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px chartreuse;

ul.li: Spirit Breaker heavily relies on disabling one enemy at a time therefore rendering him useless against five Meepos at once.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px chartreuse;

ul.li:
Earthbind, like any root, inhibits usage of
Ball Lightning , eliminating Storm Spirit's mobility.
Pugna 's Nether Ward doesn't really hurt Meepo since he has high base magical resistance and can be killed very quickly by 4 clones. Also Decrepify can amplify Geostrike damage and Poof damage.

Mirana can't use her Leap while rooted by Meepo's Earthbind and her Moonlight Shadow is countered by Meepo's truesight providing Earthbind. Meepo also has very high base magic resistance, meaning starstorm does minimal damage.
Skywrath Mage 's skills are single target and he can't use Mystic Flare to its fullest potential, since Meepo has high magic resistance and all Meepos spread the damage between them.
Arc Warden 's Flux is meaningless against Meepo who loves to group up. Meepo is also a very good gap closer, so Arc Warden's Magnetic Field becomes useless.
Night Stalker 's most skills are single targeted which allows other Meepo to Poof, Earthbind and kill him.
Slark 's Dark Pact and Pounce can deny only one Earthbind and Poof can penetrate Shadow Dance if he doesn't build Black King Bar.

Spectre 's Haunt with Radiance may be useful for counter Meepo but if Meepo finds the real one, Spectral Dagger is useless. Non-Black King Bar heroes like her will suffer from all of Meepo's abilities. Meepo is also a very large counter as Spectre takes a long time to come online, normally farming jungle or lane, which makes her an easy target for Meepo ganks.

Tinker who can't fight multiple heroes will suffer greatly against Meepo's Geostrike and Earthbind. However, Tinker with
Aghanim's Scepter can blind multiple Meepos permanently with
Laser , killing them before Poof can come off of cooldown.
Juggernaut 's Omnislash is meaningless for Meepo who can share the damage across clones to save other allies and Blade Fury only tickles Meepo, due to his innate high magic resistance.

Nature's Prophet is heavily countered by Meepo, not only Meepo can kill the Treants and Necronomicon summons (if he has it) with a single poof, but he can also stop Natures from using his teleport, and can gain vision inside sprout.

Medusa 's Stone Gaze may be useful Meepo who hard to turn behind Medusa all but same as
Wraith King who doesn't have good disable. Medusa, however, becomes a big problem with a
Mjollnir and some other items, her huge AoE from static link and her splitshot allowing her to easily kill Meepo.
Luna 's Eclipse spreads damage to each target, so Meepo won't take all the damage.

Lifestealer 's Rage and Open wounds become useless when Meepo has 4 or more clones, as he can simply hit Lifestealer once, the Geostrike slow piercing spell immunity, then kite the open wounds Meepo away, or simply prevent Lifestealer from running away.
Naga Siren 's Song of the Siren maybe useful but Poof will destroy all of her illusions.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px skyblue;

ul.li:
Glimpse and
Kinetic Field allow Meepo to land Earthbind more easily.

Enemies pinned by Earthbind make easy targets for
Static Storm , which prevents them from fighting back against Meepo with disables.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px skyblue;

ul.li: X Marks the Spot makes it easier for Meepo to land Earthbind.

Ghostship and
Torrent combine well with Meepo's kit, allowing the two of them to quickly eliminate multiple enemies. The rum buff from
Ghostship also makes Meepo and his clones much more resilient to damage.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px skyblue;

ul.li: Global Silence shuts down many of Meepo's more dangerous counters, which employ either area-of-effect disables or high area-of-effect damage.

div.style: margin:7px 5px 0px; vertical-align:center; text-align:center; display:inline-block; line-height:normal; width:80px;
margin-bottom:5px; box-shadow:0px 0px 2px 4px skyblue;

ul.li:
Storm Hammer locks down enemies to set up Meepo's other abilities and allow both of them to take the enemy down. Meepo can also initiate with Earthbind to pin down enemies and set up a multi-target
Storm Hammer .
Warcry 's area armor buff makes Meepo's clones more durable against physical damage, and the bonus movement speed combines well with Geostrike to prevent enemies from escaping.
Techies can pressure the enemy during the early game and fend off enemy pushes throughout, allowing Meepo to gain a farm advantage over his enemy.

Heroes with reliable setup abilities to help Meepo land Earthbind and Poof, such as
Vengeful Spirit ,
Naga Siren ,
Wraith King ,
Slardar ,
Shadow Shaman , and
Lion .
